author: Brett Samuels
description: Treasury Department Secretary Scott Bessent and U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will meet with their Chinese counterparts in Switzerland this week to discuss trade amid a standoff between the world’s two largest economies. Bessent will travel to Switzerland on Thursday, his office announced, where he will meet with the Swiss president. He will also meet…
title: Top Trump officials to meet in Switzerland with Chinese counterparts on trade

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said Tuesday the Pentagon has not responded to his inquiries about last week’s Army helicopter that forced two commercial passenger jets landing at Reagan Washington National Airport to shift course. When Fox News host Martha MacCallum asked if he had any additional information from the Pentagon about the flyover, Duffy said,…
title: Duffy: Pentagon not responding to helicopter inquiries

author: Rachel Frazin
description: More than 100 staff members have been fired from the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, spokespeople for the lab confirmed Tuesday. A National Renewable Energy Lab spokesperson cited “stop work orders from federal agencies, new federal directives, and budgetary shifts” in its reason for the firings. “As a result, NREL has experienced workforce impacts affecting 114…
title: More than 100 fired from National Renewable Energy Lab

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Obama Foundation touted progress on the construction of its presidential library Tuesday after President Trump mocked builders for being behind on developing the property. “We can’t wait to open our doors to the Obama Presidential Center next spring! In addition to a world-class museum, the 19.3-acre campus will feature a gymnasium, a fruit and…
title: Obama Foundation touts progress on library after Trump mockery

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A second federal judge determined President Trump exceeded his authority in using the Alien Enemies Act (AEA) to deport Venezuelans alleged to be gang members, blocking the administration from using it in the Southern District of New York. U.S. District Judge Alvin Hellerstein said Tuesday that Trump ran afoul of the law, which only may…
title: Second judge bars Trump use of Alien Enemies Act for deportations

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A former Department of Homeland Security (DHS) official who criticized President Trump in his first term said in a new interview that he thinks he was right to be concerned that the president would seek “revenge” upon his return to office. “My concern was he would turn the government into a revenge machine, and that’s…
title: ‘Anonymous’ author on concerns of Trump creating ‘revenge machine’: ‘That’s what’s happening’

author: Tara Suter
description: Two co-hosts of the popular liberal podcast “Pod Save America” mocked President Trump over comments he made on Monday about their ex-boss, former President Obama. During a Monday meeting with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, Trump commented on the building of the Obama Presidential Center. “He’s building his library in Chicago,” Trump said of Obama…
title: ‘Pod Save America’ hosts mock Trump over Obama library jabs

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has tapped Vinay Prasad, a prominent critic of federal COVID-19 policies and a proponent of more stringent approval standards, to lead the agency’s vaccines division.  Prasad replaces Peter Marks, the longtime leader of the Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research (CBER), who resigned in March after clashing with Health…
title: FDA taps critic of COVID policies, drug industry to lead vaccines division

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Harvard President Alan Garber reflected on Harvard’s front-line position in the Trump administration’s battle with higher education, saying some common ground is found in the problems but not in the solutions.   “It’s less that I chose to take on the fight than that the fight came to me,” Garber told The Wall Street Journal…
title: ‘The fight came to me’: Harvard president reflects on battle with Trump administration

author: Alex Gangitano
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he asked President Trump during their meeting Tuesday to stop calling his neighbors to the north the 51st state, insisting the president will not get his “wish.” In a press conference at the Canadian Embassy following his meeting at the White House, a reporter asked Carney if he pushed…
title: Carney says he asked Trump in White House meeting to stop calling Canada 51st state

author: Rachel Scully
description: Germany’s conservative leader Friedrich Merz was successfully elected chancellor of the country Tuesday after a historic initial defeat on his first ballot, which caused tumult in the Bundestag, or the lower house of parliament. Merz, the leader of the center-right Christian Democratic Union (CDU), won the second ballot, securing his role as the 10th chancellor…
title: What to know about the roller-coaster day in German politics

author: The Hill Staff
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to give remarks from the British Embassy in Washington Tuesday afternoon following his visit with President Trump at the White House. Their first in-person meeting since Carney was elected to replace former leader Justin Trudeau was largely shadowed by Trump’s tariffs against Canada and his repeated musings about…
title: Watch live: Canadian prime minister briefs reporters following meeting with Trump

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A coalition of universities and corresponding organizations sued the National Science Foundation (NSF) on Monday over slated funding cuts to schools.  The federal agency said Friday it would no longer reimburse indirect costs for research exceeding 15 percent. “For decades, universities have built their research institutions on the government’s settled approach to funding the actual…
title: Universities sue over National Science Foundation funding cuts

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Recently declassified intelligence contradicts Trump administration claims that the Tren de Aragua gang is coordinating with the Venezuelan government – undercutting a key basis for President Trump’s ignition of wartime powers to remove its citizens to a Salvadoran prison. In justifying his use of the 1789 Alien Enemies Act, Trump accused Tren de Aragua (TDA)…
title: US intelligence document undercuts Trump claims on Tren de Aragua gang, Alien Enemies Act

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Democrats on Tuesday launched a long-shot effort to shield Medicaid and food stamps from GOP cuts.  The Democrats are pushing a procedural gambit, known as a discharge petition, that would force a House vote on legislation protecting the two low-income benefit programs from cuts under President Trump’s “big beautiful bill.” The petition requires 218…
title: Democrats launch effort to shield Medicaid and food stamps from GOP cuts

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: People with celiac disease can safely kiss their partners who have just ingested gluten, according to the results of a new study — though researchers recommend drinking some water first. The analysis, whose findings were presented Monday at Digestive Disease Week 2025, sought to answer a question that its authors say is frequently asked but…
title: Celiac sufferers can safely kiss bread-eaters, study says

author: Rep. Pat Fallon (R-Texas), opinion contributor
description: Ariel Murphy's persistence led to the passage of the Kairo and Kids Act in Texas, which guarantees parents access to security footage from daycare centers if they suspect their child has been abused, and similar legislation is being considered at the federal level.
title: Abuse in daycare: Congress can affirm parents’ right to transparency

author: Lauren Irwin
description: Longtime Republican strategist Karl Rove criticized Beto O’Rourke as one of the Democratic Party’s “lesser lights,” after he said his fellow Democrats are lazy.  Rove joined Fox News’s “America’s Newsroom,” on Tuesday, bringing out his whiteboard to criticize the Texas Democrat. O’Rourke slammed Democratic leadership as “lazy” on a different broadcast over the weekend. “I…
title: Karl Rove: Beto O’Rourke one of Democrats’ ‘lesser lights’

author: Julia Manchester
description: Fairfax County Supervisor James Walkinshaw (D) launched his campaign for Virginia’s 11th Congressional District on Tuesday in a bid to replace his former boss, outgoing Rep. Gerry Connolly (D-Va.).  Walkinshaw worked as Connolly’s chief of staff for more than 10 years before serving as county supervisor. The announcement comes a week after Connolly announced he…
title: Connelly’s former chief of staff launches bid for boss’ House seat

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The United States’s trade deficit swelled in the first quarter as the onset of President Trump’s tariffs rattle the nation’s economy and global relations. The U.S. Census Bureau and the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis said Tuesday the goods and services deficit was $140.5 billion in March, an 8 percent increase from the month prior. …
title: US trade deficit expands in first quarter

author: Judy Kurtz
description: John Oliver doesn’t appear to be a fan of making a British version of “Saturday Night Live,” calling the forthcoming edition of the show a “terrible idea.” “It just feels like this ‘Saturday Night Live’ is such a unique group,” Oliver said during a Monday interview on “Late Night with Seth Meyers,” referring to the cast of…
title: John Oliver calls UK version of ‘Saturday Night Live’ a ‘terrible idea’

author: Brooke Migdon
description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday allowed President Trump’s administration to begin enforcing a ban on transgender troops serving openly in the military, undermining two lower court decisions and handing a victory to an administration that has broadly sought to restrict transgender rights.  The Justice Department asked the justices in an emergency application last month to lift a…
title: Supreme Court allows Trump administration to enforce trans military ban

author: Dirk Auer, opinion contributor
description: Europe’s leaders should ask themselves whether this is really a battle worth waging.
title: Europe’s tech battle could cost it the trade war

author: Jared Gans
description: Vice President Vance called on voters to back his half-brother in the primary for the Cincinnati mayoral race on Tuesday. “Hey Cincinnati! My brother Cory Bowman is running for mayor and is on the ballot today for the primary. He’s a good guy with a heart for serving his community,” Vance said in a post…
title: Vance backs half-brother ahead of Cincinnati mayoral primary

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said Tuesday that travelers without Real ID-compliant cards will still be able to board their flights for the time being — even once the law fully takes effect Wednesday. In testimony before a House Appropriations subcommittee, however, Noem said those individuals without proper identification will likely face additional steps before…
title: Noem says travelers lacking Real ID can still fly, for now

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Tuesday teased that a “big announcement” is coming before he leaves for his trip to the Middle East early next week. “I think before then we’re going to have a very, very big announcement to make. Like, as big as it gets and I won’t tell you on what. But, and it’s…
title: Trump teases ‘very big announcement’ ahead of Middle East trip

author: Mike Lillis
description: California Democrats are hammering President Trump’s recent proposal to slap new tariffs on foreign-made films. The lawmakers are warning that, if it’s imposed, Trump’s 100-percent levy would simply result in higher costs for movie consumers in the United States.  “This is just nonsensical,” Rep. Pete Aguilar (Calif.), chairman of the House Democratic Caucus, told reporters…
title: California Democrats bash Trump’s foreign-film tariffs: ‘Nonsensical’

description: A federal appeals court rejected the Trump administration’s request to revoke the temporary legal status of nearly a million migrants living in the country. In an order Monday, the 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals declined to put a hold on a judge’s order that stopped the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) from terminating parole…
title: Courts rejects Trump administration request to revoke some migrants’ protected status

description: Stephen A. Smith accused Democrats of “forgetting” about Black Americans, leading to President Trump’s small boost in support among the demographic during the 2024 election. Speaking on NewsNation’s “Cuomo” Monday night, Smith said Democrats don’t take the time to tell Black voters what they have been doing successfully. Instead, he said, they simply repeat the…
title: Stephen A. Smith: Democrats ‘forgot about’ Black Americans

description: Former Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio said he met with President Trump this weekend at the president’s Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida. description: A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to allow about 12,000 additional refugees into the country, rejecting the White House's argument that previously approved migrants could be turned away if they did not arrive in the U.S. by early February.
title: Trump administration ordered to admit thousands of refugees

description: The reason for this is straightforward: China is a market that Hollywood covets.

description: House Republican leaders will brief reporters Tuesday morning amid a push to pass President Trump’s legislative agenda before Memorial Day. Key policy hang-ups — primarily around tax cuts and Medicaid funding — have threatened to upend Speaker Mike Johnson’s roadmap to advancing the package. The Tuesday remarks also come days after the White House unveiled…

description: President Trump has just carried out the first of what may be a series of Cabinet changes, especially in the national security area.
title: Trump faces a moment of truth with Russia and China

description: The conservative group American Action Network rolled out a $7 million ad buy on Tuesday hitting back against Democrats attacking Republicans over potential cuts to Medicaid.  The broadcast, cable, and digital campaign will air in 30 Republican and Democratic congressional districts through the first week of June.    The American Action Network is connected to the…
title: Conservative group launches $7M ad buy responding to Medicaid attacks

description: Melania Trump is paying homage to a fellow first lady, helping to unveil a postage stamp honoring Barbara Bush. The first lady will host a Thursday ceremony at the White House that will feature the first look at the U.S. Postal Service stamp dedicated to the wife of late President George H.W. Bush. Barbara Bush,…

description: The Education Department sent a “Dear Colleague” letter to universities on Monday warning them of their obligations to support student loan borrowers as the Trump administration ramps up collections for those in default. While the department says borrowers have the “primary responsibility” to ensure they repay their loans, schools should make sure they support their…

description: Democrats should put their investments in blind trusts to avoid the appearance of corruption and gain a moral high ground in the upcoming elections.

description: Workers expect flexibility and will settle for nothing less.

description: Trump is drawing from a familiar playbook, clothing his latest act of election interference with the pretext that he is protecting election integrity.

description: Most parents with children (77%) say raising kids has been far more expensive than expected, a LendingTree survey found.

description: When it comes to helping young women facing unexpected pregnancies, politicians should avoid getting themselves on the wrong side of yet another 80/20 issue.

description: A federal judge ordered the North Carolina Board of Elections on Monday to certify the results of the state’s Supreme Court election, giving Democratic incumbent Justice Allison Riggs the upper hand in the still-contested race. Chief U.S. District Judge Richard E. Myers ruled Monday that the state board must certify the results of the November…
title: Federal judge rules North Carolina must certify state Supreme Court victory
